articles.headline: At Auto Engineers' School, a Course in Layoffs 101
articles.snippet: Gone are the days when students of Kettering University could be assured of a career at General Motors.
articles.abstract: Gone are the days when students of Kettering University could be assured of a career at General Motors.

articles.headline: Banking Plan Propels Wall St. to Best Day in Months
articles.snippet: Details of the government’s plan to fix problems at the country’s banks brought a glimmer of hope for a recovery to Wall Street.
articles.abstract: Details of the government’s plan to fix problems at the country’s banks brought a glimmer of hope for a recovery to Wall Street.
articles.lead_paragraph: Details of the government’s plans to clean up the nation’s banks ignited a blazing stock market rally on Monday, lifting Wall Street to its best one-day performance in five months and tempting some investors to imagine what they would not have dared just a few weeks ago  that the worst may finally be over.

articles.headline: Rescue Plan, With Fine Print, Dazzles Wall Street
articles.snippet: Treasury Secretary Timothy F. Geithner staged a comeback after his first presentation of the bank recovery plan fizzled six weeks ago.
articles.abstract: Treasury Secretary Timothy F. Geithner staged a comeback after his first presentation of the bank recovery plan fizzled six weeks ago.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON  This time President Obama directed some of the stagecraft. This time Treasury Secretary Timothy F. Geithner fleshed out the substance of their long-anticipated program to remove banks’ toxic assets and revive the financial system. And this time the reaction was widely positive, giving the embattled Mr. Geithner a critically needed boost.

articles.headline: A.I.G. Bonuses of $50 Million Will Be Repaid
articles.snippet: Attorney General Andrew M. Cuomo of New York said 15 of the top 20 bonus recipients in A.I.G.’s financial products division had returned their bonuses.
articles.abstract: Attorney General Andrew M. Cuomo of New York said 15 of the top 20 bonus recipients in A.I.G.’s financial products division had returned their bonuses.
articles.lead_paragraph: The New York State attorney general, Andrew M. Cuomo, said on Monday that he had persuaded nine of the top 10 bonus recipients at the American International Group to give the money back, as the Senate retreated on plans to tax such bonuses.
articles.byline: By Mary Williams Walsh and Carl Hulse

articles.headline: Strip-Search of Girl Tests Limit of School Policy
articles.snippet: The Supreme Court will consider how far school officials can go to enforce zero-tolerance drug policies.
articles.abstract: The Supreme Court will consider how far school officials can go to enforce zero-tolerance drug policies.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAFFORD, Ariz.  Savana Redding still remembers the clothes she had on  black stretch pants with butterfly patches and a pink T-shirt  the day school officials here forced her to strip six years ago. She was 13 and in eighth grade.

articles.headline: Nafta’s Promise, Unfulfilled
articles.snippet: Fifteen years after the North American Free Trade Agreement took effect, the pact, in some cases, has produced results that were exactly opposite of what was promised.
articles.abstract: Fifteen years after the North American Free Trade Agreement took effect, the pact, in some cases, has produced results that were exactly opposite of what was promised.
articles.lead_paragraph: MEXICO CITY  Mexico’s former president, Carlos Salinas, used to promise that free trade and foreign investment would jump-start this country’s development, empowering a richer and more prosperous Mexico “to export goods, not people.”

articles.headline: If Goldman Returns Aid, Will Others?
articles.snippet: If Goldman succeeds in returning our money, it could put pressure on other banks to give their money back, too, lest they appear weak.
articles.abstract: If Goldman succeeds in returning our money, it could put pressure on other banks to give their money back, too, lest they appear weak.
articles.lead_paragraph: Any good news these days  not that there is much  seems to come with an asterisk. The market is popping, but, as some bears ask, is it just a setup for another bigger fall?
